Prompt.pre_question_prompt: I am a time-travelling journalist. I am traveling back in time to interview $interviewee$. I will ask him following 15 questions.
Prompt.intermediate_prompt: I am $interviewee$. I will answer above questions.
Prompt.task_specific_prompt: Create a newspaper article based upon above answers.

QApair.Question: 1. Sir Issac Newton, can you please tell us what inspired you to become a scientist?
QApair.Answer: 1. I was inspired to become a scientist by my curiosity. I wanted to understand how the world works and how we can discover its secrets.

QApair.Question: 2. What was your motivation behind your work on optics and gravity?
QApair.Answer: 2. My motivation behind my work on optics and gravity was to gain a better understanding of the physical world around us. I wanted to know how light behaves and how it affects the objects around us. I also wanted to understand the force of gravity and how it affects the movement of objects.

QApair.Question: 3. What obstacles or challenges did you face while conducting your experiments?
QApair.Answer: 3. The biggest obstacle I faced while conducting my experiments was the lack of technology. In my time, we did not have the sophisticated equipment that we have today. This made it difficult to accurately measure the effects of my experiments.

QApair.Question: 4. How did you overcome them?
QApair.Answer: 4. I overcame this obstacle by using my theoretical knowledge to design experiments that could be conducted with the available technology. I also developed new methods of data collection and analysis.

QApair.Question: 5. What are your thoughts on the role of mathematics in physics?
QApair.Answer: 5. I believe that mathematics is essential for physics. It allows us to formulate precise models of the physical world and to make predictions about the results of experiments.

QApair.Question: 6. What was your experience working with Robert Hooke?
QApair.Answer: 6. I had a good experience working with Robert Hooke. He was a very talented scientist and we had a lot of fruitful discussions.

QApair.Question: 7. How did your work on the three laws of motion contribute to our understanding of the physical world?
QApair.Answer: 7. My work on the three laws of motion helped to establish the basic principles of classical mechanics. These laws are still used today to explain the motion of objects.

QApair.Question: 8. What are your thoughts on the role of experimentation in physics?
QApair.Answer: 8. I believe that experimentation is essential for physics. It allows us to test our theories and to verify our predictions.

QApair.Question: 9. What insights did you gain from your work on the theory of gravity?
QApair.Answer: 9. The work on the theory of gravity led to the development of the law of universal gravitation. This law explains the force of gravity and its effects on the movement of objects.

QApair.Question: 10. How did your work on calculus contribute to the development of mathematics?
QApair.Answer: 10. My work on calculus helped to develop the mathematics of change. This branch of mathematics is essential for the study of physics.

QApair.Question: 11. What are your thoughts on the role of physics in society?
QApair.Answer: 11. I believe that physics is essential for society. It helps us to understand the world around us and to make technological advances.

QApair.Question: 12. What do you believe is the most important legacy of your work?
QApair.Answer: 12. I believe that the most important legacy of my work is the development of classical mechanics. This branch of physics is essential for the understanding of the physical world.

QApair.Question: 13. What advice would you give to young scientists who are just starting out?
QApair.Answer: 13. My advice to young scientists is to be curious and to never give up. Curiosity is the key to making new discoveries. And, even if you fail at first, you must never give up.

QApair.Question: 14. What do you believe is the future of physics?
QApair.Answer: 14. I believe that the future of physics is very bright. We have only scratched the surface of knowledge and there is much more to be discovered.

QApair.Question: 15. What are your thoughts on the role of physics in the 21st century?
QApair.Answer: 15. I believe that physics is essential for the 21st century. It helps us to understand the world around us and to make technological advances.

Instances.Output:
In an exclusive interview, time-travelling journalist sits down with Sir Issac Newton to discuss his life, work, and legacy.

Newton, who is widely regarded as one of the most influential scientists of all time, discusses his motivation for becoming a scientist, his work on optics and gravity, and the role of mathematics in physics. He also shares his thoughts on the importance of experimentation, the theory of gravity, and the future of physics.

Newton offers advice to young scientists starting out in their careers, and shares his belief that physics is essential for the 21st century. He also discusses the most important legacy of his work, which is the development of classical mechanics.

This fascinating interview provides insight into the mind of one of the most brilliant scientists of all time, and offers a glimpse into the future of physics.

QApair.Question: 1. What inspired you to become a political leader?
QApair.Answer: 1. I was inspired to become a political leader by my experiences in South Africa, where I saw firsthand the injustice of racial discrimination.

QApair.Question: 2. What motivated you to fight for India's independence?
QApair.Answer: 2. I was motivated to fight for India's independence because I saw how the British colonial government was oppressing my people.

QApair.Question: 3. What methods did you use to achieve your goals?
QApair.Answer: 3. I used a variety of methods to achieve my goals, including nonviolent resistance, civil disobedience, and mass protests.

QApair.Question: 4. How did you manage to unify the Indian people?
QApair.Answer: 4. I managed to unify the Indian people by appealing to their shared culture and values.

QApair.Question: 5. What obstacles did you face during your struggle?
QApair.Answer: 5. I faced many obstacles during my struggle, including violence from the British colonial government and opposition from within India.

QApair.Question: 6. How did you overcome them?
QApair.Answer: 6. I overcame these obstacles by maintaining my commitment to nonviolence and by winning over the support of the Indian people.

QApair.Question: 7. What impact did your movement have on British rule in India?
QApair.Answer: 7. My movement had a significant impact on British rule in India, leading to the withdrawal of the British colonial government.

QApair.Question: 8. How did your philosophy of nonviolent resistance influence subsequent political movements?
QApair.Answer: 8. My philosophy of nonviolent resistance influenced subsequent political movements, including the civil rights movement in the United States.

QApair.Question: 9. What do you think are the most important lessons to be learned from your life and work?
QApair.Answer: 9. The most important lessons to be learned from my life and work are the importance of nonviolence and the power of unity.

QApair.Question: 10. How do you see India's future development?
QApair.Answer: 10. I see India's future development as being based on economic self-reliance and social justice.

QApair.Question: 11. What are your thoughts on economic development and poverty alleviation?
QApair.Answer: 11. My thoughts on economic development and poverty alleviation are that they can best be achieved through a mix of government action and private enterprise.

QApair.Question: 12. What is your opinion on caste and religious discrimination?
QApair.Answer: 12. I believe that caste and religious discrimination are wrong and counterproductive, and I have worked to promote equality between all people.

QApair.Question: 13. What do you think about the role of women in society?
QApair.Answer: 13. I believe that women should have equal rights and opportunities as men, and I have worked to promote women's rights throughout my career.

QApair.Question: 14. What is your vision for India's foreign policy?
QApair.Answer: 14. My vision for India's foreign policy is one of peace and friendship with all nations.

QApair.Question: 15. What are your thoughts on the role of the media in a democracy?
QApair.Answer: 15. I believe that the media has an important role to play in a democracy, and I have always worked to ensure that the media is free and independent.

Instances.Output:
In an exclusive interview, Mahatama Gandhi shares his thoughts on a variety of topics, from his inspirations for becoming a political leader to his vision for India's future.

Gandhi discusses his motivation for fighting for India's independence, saying that he was inspired by the unjust treatment of his people by the British colonial government. He describes his methods for achieving his goals, including nonviolent resistance and mass protests, and explains how he managed to unify the Indian people.

Gandhi talks about the obstacles he faced during his struggle, including violence from the British government and opposition from within India, and how he overcame them. He discusses the impact his movement had on British rule in India, and how his philosophy of nonviolent resistance influenced subsequent political movements.

Gandhi shares his thoughts on the most important lessons to be learned from his life and work, and offers his vision for India's future development. He discusses his thoughts on economic development and poverty alleviation, and shares his opinion on caste and religious discrimination. Gandhi also talks about the role of women in society and his vision for India's foreign policy.

Finally, Gandhi shares his thoughts on the role of the media in a democracy, stressing the importance of a free and independent media.

QApair.Question: 1) How would you describe your musical style?
QApair.Answer: 1) My musical style can be described as a mix of rock, blues, and country.

QApair.Question: 2) How did you develop your musical style?
QApair.Answer: 2) I developed my musical style by listening to and watching a variety of artists, including Hank Williams and Little Richard.

QApair.Question: 3) What influenced your musical style?
QApair.Answer: 3) My musical style was influenced by the music I heard growing up in the south, as well as the artists I mentioned above.

QApair.Question: 4) How did you become a musician?
QApair.Answer: 4) I became a musician because I loved music and I wanted to share my talents with the world.

QApair.Question: 5) What was your first musical experience?
QApair.Answer: 5) My first musical experience was singing in the church choir.

QApair.Question: 6) How did you first get into music?
QApair.Answer: 6) I first got into music when I was a teenager and I started playing guitar.

QApair.Question: 7) What is your favorite Elvis Presley song?
QApair.Answer: 7) My favorite Elvis Presley song is "Hound Dog."

QApair.Question: 8) What is your favorite Elvis Presley album?
QApair.Answer: 8) My favorite Elvis Presley album is "Elvis Presley."

QApair.Question: 9) What are your thoughts on the current state of the music industry?
QApair.Answer: 9) I think the current state of the music industry is good. There are a lot of talented artists out there making great music.

QApair.Question: 10) How do you feel about your place in the music industry?
QApair.Answer: 10) I feel very fortunate to have had the career that I have had. I am grateful to my fans for their support.

QApair.Question: 11) What is your songwriting process like?
QApair.Answer: 11) My songwriting process usually starts with a feeling or an idea that I want to express. I then start working on the music and the lyrics.

QApair.Question: 12) What are your thoughts on live performances?
QApair.Answer: 12) I enjoy performing live. I think it's a great way to connect with fans and to share my music.

QApair.Question: 13) What is the most memorable live performance you`ve ever given?
QApair.Answer: 13) One of the most memorable live performances I've ever given was at Madison Square Garden in 1972.

QApair.Question: 14) What is the best advice you`ve ever been given about music?
QApair.Answer: 14) The best advice I've ever been given about music is to just be myself and to always stay true to my vision.

QApair.Question: 15) What advice would you give to aspiring musicians?
QApair.Answer: 15) My advice to aspiring musicians is to work hard and to never give up on your dreams.

Instances.Output:
In an interview with a time-traveling journalist, Elvis Presley described his musical style as a mix of rock, blues, and country. He developed his musical style by listening to and watching a variety of artists, including Hank Williams and Little Richard. His musical style was influenced by the music he heard growing up in the south, as well as the artists he mentioned above.

Presley became a musician because he loved music and he wanted to share his talents with the world. His first musical experience was singing in the church choir. He first got into music when he was a teenager and he started playing guitar.

His favorite Elvis Presley song is "Hound Dog." His favorite Elvis Presley album is "Elvis Presley." He thinks the current state of the music industry is good. He feels very fortunate to have had the career that he has had.

His songwriting process usually starts with a feeling or an idea that he wants to express. He then starts working on the music and the lyrics. He enjoys performing live. He thinks it's a great way to connect with fans and to share his music.

One of the most memorable live performances he's ever given was at Madison Square Garden in 1972. The best advice he's ever been given about music is to just be himself and to always stay true to his vision. His advice to aspiring musicians is to work hard and to never give up on your dreams.
